title: Sri Lanka to introduce anti-hoarding laws for food stocks – PM
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka would introduce new laws to prevent hoarding of food stocks, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe  said on Wednesday (15) as the island nation is facing a looming food crisis amid a worsening economic crisis and skyrocketing food inflation.
Wickremesinghe said this when he met with representatives of the commercial banks to discuss the loans requested by rice mill owners.

“The Prime Minister also stated that the government would introduce new legislation that will govern rice mill owners and silo owners to prevent future hoarding of food stocks,” Wickremesinghe’s office said in a statement.

Government officials in the trade and agricultural sector have told Economy Next that hoarding of rice stocks has been on the rice among farmers and millers. Most farmers are hoarding their rice produce to future use, while some farmers and most millers are hoarding rice to exploit the public when the prices rise.

Rice prices have more than doubled in the last one year mainly due to rice shortage after chemical fertilizer ban, despite the government attempted to import from India and Myanmar.  (Colombo/June 15/2022)
